newsitem.title: USA: LPC - Citibank syndicating $2 bln credit for Boeing.
newsitem.headline: LPC - Citibank syndicating $2 bln credit for Boeing.

text.p: NEW YORK, September 4 (LPC) - Administrative agent Citibank is syndicating a $2 billion credit for Boeing Co, banking sources said.
The deal replaces a $3 billion loan put in place last September, sources added.
The loan package is split evenly between a 364-day credit facility and a seven-year revolver, according to bankers.
Pricing on the shorter tranche starts at 15.5 basis points over the London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR) for drawn portions of the credit, plus a five basis-point annual fee, a source said.
The seven-year tranche is priced at 12.5 basis points over LIBOR on drawn portions, plus an eight basis-point annual fee, the source added.
Last year's deal was split between a $1 billion, 364-day facility and a $2 billion, seven-year revolver, sources said. Pricing was the same as that on the new facility, they said.
